Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "WebRequest.DefaultWebProxy non null on simulator" (#3332) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened pull request "[docs] Add template file for draft release notes" (#3331) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The idea for this new `Documentation/release-notes/master.md` file is
that each time a new user-facing bug fix or feature is merged to
`master`, the author(s) of the change will add a corresponding draft
release note to this file.  The note can be added as part of the source
code pull request itself, or it can be added in a separate follow-up
pull request shortly afterward.

If the note for a new feature uses images, the images can be added to
`Documentation/release-notes/images/`.

Authors of new fixes and improvements don't need to do anything special
if their changes get cherry-picked from `master` to a release branch.
The team members who handle final release notes preparation and
publication will copy or move notes as needed from `master.md` to
earlier releases for changes that get cherry-picked.

The `master.md` template follows the same section order as the [final
published release notes][0], but it omits a few details like release
dates that aren't needed in the draft format.

The final notes also follow the text formatting rules described in the
[xamarin-docs contribution guidelines][1].  The draft notes don't need
to follow those guidelines too strictly.  For example, it's fine to use
backticks around paths in these draft notes rather than italics.  That
makes it easier to avoid unintentional formatting issues when paths
include characters like `_` or `*`.

Similarly, there's no need to worry about list indentation or line
wrapping in these draft notes.  Authors can optionally wrap lines to 80
characters and indent list items to match the example items, but it's
not required.

As part of branching for a new release, the current `master.md` file
will be renamed to match the new release branch name, and a new empty
template `master.md` file will be added by copying the original template
from this commit and updating the version numbers.

[0]: https://docs.microsoft.com/xamarin/android/release-notes/
[1]: https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/xamarin-docs/blob/live/contributing-guidelines/template.md

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Shell] Flyout TableView height fix and implement margins for Flyout Header" (#6572) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

- fix ListView to be full height and not cut off at bottom safe area
- Respect the margins defined on the HeaderView. On iOS if the user hasn't set the margin then it just gets set to the safe area. This allows the user to zero this out if they want the view to be up against the top of the device
- Fix tableview height on iOS to be the full height of the devices 

### Issues Resolved ### 

- fixes #6801

### Platforms Affected ### 
- iOS
- Android

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###
<!-- Describe any changes that may change how a user's app behaves or appears when upgrading to this version of the codebase. -->

None

### Before/After Screenshots ### 

*Left is After/ Right is Before*

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5375137/60468195-2413c600-9c16-11e9-993e-c31bd4050be9.png)

*The TableView now goes all the way to the bottom*

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5375137/60468684-a18c0600-9c17-11e9-9fc8-140302e0bd60.png)



### Testing Procedure ###
- Test the store shell with various FH Scroll settings/ height/ and margin6

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] Problem enabling Use Fast Development" (#6814) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
cant emulate my android project when enabling `Use Fast Development`.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Enable `Use Fast Development`
2. Rebuild
3. Run on my samsung s9 edge

### Expected Behavior
the app should start on the mobile
### Actual Behavior
the app start and then shutdown directly without any errors.
as for visual studio, the emulator stop
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.1.0.555618
- Last known good version: hmm dont remember really, i think 4.0.0.425677
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - Android: 9.0
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices: samsung s9 edge

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug] iOS Forms Previewer does not properly resolve resources" (#6813) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
When the resource is in different library the XAML iOS Previewer does not resolve the resource properly.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create iOS Xamarin.Forms project
2. Create new library Lib1
3. In Lib1 create resource file with style A and style B
4. In Lib1 create two views view A and B with styles A and  B; where view B extends view A.
5. In the main project create view C that extends view B
6. In the previewer view C shows with style A instead of style B

(When application runs the view C shows correctly with style B.)

### Expected Behavior
In the forms previewer View C should show with style B inherited from view B.

### Actual Behavior
View C is showing with style A.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms v.4.1.0
- IDE: Visual Studio for Windows

### Repro
[App7.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3365926/App7.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] Pull to refresh ListView: empty cells when refreshing list after scrolling on Android" (#6810) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

When a list view implements the "pull to refresh" feature, refreshing the list after scrolling causes some cells to become empty. The empty cells become visible again after scrolling down so that they disappear from the view port, and then scrolling up.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Clone the official sample project [Xamarin.Forms ListView Sample: Interactivity](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-forms-samples/tree/master/UserInterface/ListView/Interactivity)
2. Edit the file `interactiveListViewXaml.xaml.cs` and change the initialization of the static list `items` so that it contains enough elements to allow scrolling.
```cs
// Replace this:
items = new ObservableCollection<string> () { "Speaker", "Pen", "Lamp", "Monitor", "Bag", "Book", "Cap", "Tote", "Floss", "Phone"};

// By this:
items = new ObservableCollection<string>();
for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++)
{
    items.Add($"Item #{i}");
}
```
3. Run the app on a device. The main page appears and displays the list.
4. Scroll down, then scroll up.
5. Pull to refresh the list.
6. Observe that some cells become empty after the list view has been refreshed.

### Expected Behavior

All cells should be visible after the list view has been refreshed.

### Actual Behavior

Some cells are empty after refreshing the list.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms version 4.1.0.555618
- Last known good version: XF version 3.6.0.539721
- IDE: Visual Studio 2019 16.1.2
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  N/A<!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
  - Android: 9.0<!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
  - UWP:  N/A<!-- The version of the UWP SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 16299 --> 
- Affected Devices: Motorola Moto G3 XT1541 with Android 6.0.1

### Screenshots

#### Listview in its initial state
![01-initial-list](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37797661/60767112-0c738c00-a0b3-11e9-9107-14576b1b90fd.png)

#### Scroll down
![02-scroll-down](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37797661/60767113-0c738c00-a0b3-11e9-8194-fa0c4d21b261.png)

#### Scroll up, then refresh
![03-scroll-up](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37797661/60767114-0d0c2280-a0b3-11e9-93d8-603b2b9f2158.png)

#### See the empty cells
![04-list-after-refresh](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37797661/60767115-0d0c2280-a0b3-11e9-94b4-78ca4b53876b.png)



<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Enhancement] Picker Right side Icon and item template!" (#6809) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Can you please add feature to change the right side icon of a picker.
And also to add an item template for drop down view icons ( Syncfusion already has this feature. but it is a paid control).

![Screenshot_1562480625](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14989528/60764895-5fe3db00-a0af-11e9-991d-44443be36754.png)

I created this kind of UI using a grid. 

but its easy if you can provide us a great component.

<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Currently facing the following error in azure pipeline after upgrading XF from 4.0 to 4.1. The problem is that it works locally but building with azure pipelines return this error. Maybe this isn't a XF problem but a config problem on my/pipelines side. With 4.0 it worked 4.1 not. 

This is the only thing that was working with macOS Menus it could be the problem:  https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/pull/4718
